question.title: How to find where the version of org.apache.maven dependencies is set?
question.body:
i have a Plugin with some dependencies from org.apache.maven. Their version is not declared in the plugin POM, but seems to be managed in one of the parent POMs. I would like to know if there is a way to determine exactly where and how their version is determined, preferably with Eclipse or IntelliJ.

I cant post the full POMs, only outtakes. These are the dependencies in the plugin POM:

    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.maven</groupId>
      <artifactId>maven-plugin-api</artifactId>
      <version>3.9.0</version>
      <exclusions>
        <exclusion>
          <groupId>javax.enterprise</groupId>
          <artifactId>cdi-api</artifactId>
        </exclusion>
      </exclusions>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.maven</groupId>
      <artifactId>maven-core</artifactId>
      <version>3.9.0</version>
      <scope>provided</scope>
    </dependency>

The properties settings in this POM:

  <properties>    
    <maven.runtime.version>3.9.0</maven.runtime.version>
    <maven.plugin.version>3.9.0</maven.plugin.version>
  </properties>

This is what the dependencies look like in the effective POM:

       <dependency>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-plugin-api</artifactId>
        <version>3.9.3</version>
      </dependency>
      <dependency>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-core</artifactId>
        <version>3.9.3</version>
      </dependency>

When i go to the "manage dependencies" window in Eclipse and click one of these dependencies i get the message: Dependency maven-core-3.9.0 already declared with version 3.9.3 under org.apache.maven:maven:3.9.3Â´s dependency Management.

Nowhere in any of the parent POMs the maven version is declared to be 3.9.3. So i would like to know, what can set the maven version to 3.9.3 in a maven-plugin project and wether there is a way to see how exactly dependency Management in Maven works out.

Edit: I have maven 3.9.8 installed on my windows btw.

answers.body:
Every Apache Maven project inherits some configurations and dependencies from the "Super POM" Check the documentation out: Introduction to the POM check the Super POM section, there is a link with the Super POM and it depends on which version of Maven you are running.

To see the dependency tree you can run in the root folder of your project:

mvn dependency:tree

79653076.body: You will need to check which version of maven is actually running on whatever you are looking at "effective pom" this is a feature of an IDE and usually IDE's have their own embedded Maven version. So check what is the version your IDE is running.

i have maven 3.9.8 installed on my windows, the dependencies are declared with version 3.9.0, yet they are set to 3.9.3 in the effective POM. So i would like to know what maven mechanism does that, or how i can find out where the version 3.9.3 comes from to sleep in peace.
